alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Jefferson; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:08PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Waukesha, northern Jefferson and southern Dodge Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Johnson Creek, or near Watertown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Watertown, Delafield, Lake Mills, Waterloo, Okauchee Lake, Oconomowoc, Johnson Creek, Dousman, Lac La Belle, Ixonia, Ashippun, Lebanon, Milford, Waterville, Oconomowoc Lake, Mapleton, Hubbleton, Summit, Pipersville and Monterey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
